title: meta
description: A metadata file describing a file or directory. The metadata file name concatenates the described item's name with a final string segment of '_meta.json'.

_id.description: The ID of the file or directory. This ID must be one of the values found within the 'Ids' object.

Ids.description: The known checksum-derived IDs of the item.

MD5.description: The MD5-related ID of the item.

SHA1.description: The SHA1-related ID of the item.

SHA256.description: The SHA256-related ID of the item.

SHA512.description: The SHA512-related ID of the item.

Name.description: The name of the file or directory. If the item is a file, this string will include the file's extension.

NameHashes.description: The checksums of the item's Name string.

MD5.description: The MD5 checksum of the item's Name string.

SHA1.description: The SHA1 checksum of the item's Name string.

SHA256.description: The SHA256 checksum of the item's Name string.

SHA512.description: The SHA512 checksum of the item's Name string.

ContentHashes.description: The checksums of the item's content (if the item is a file).

MD5.description: The MD5 checksum of the item's content.

SHA1.description: The SHA1 checksum of the item's content.

SHA256.description: The SHA256 checksum of the item's content.

SHA512.description: The SHA512 checksum of the item's content.

Extension.description: The extension of the file (if the item is a file).

BaseName.description: The base name of the file or directory. This string may be identical to the 'Name' string.

StorageName.description: The finalized name of the file or directory as it is stored in the system. This string will always begin with the '_id' of the item.

anyOf.description: If the item is a directory, this field will be null.
Information about the encoding of the file's content.

Size.description: The size of a file in bytes (if the item is a file), or the size of all contained files and directories (if the item is a directory).

IsDirectory.description: A boolean value indicating whether the item is a directory.

IsLink.description: A boolean value indicating whether the item is a symbolic link.

ParentId.description: The ID of the parent directory of the file or directory. If the item is at the root of the system, this field will be 'x'.

UnixTimeAccessed.description: The Unix timestamp from when the file or directory was last accessed. This field should include milliseconds.

UnixTimeCreated.description: The Unix timestamp from when the file or directory was created. This field should include milliseconds.

UnixTimeModified.description: The Unix timestamp from when the file or directory was last modified. This field should include milliseconds.

TimeAccessed.description: The local date and time when the file or directory was last accessed. This string is in the format 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffffffzzz'.

TimeCreated.description: The local date and time when the file or directory was created. This string is in the format 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffffffzzz'.

TimeModified.description: The local date and time when the file or directory was last modified. This string is in the format 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffffffzzz'.

Items.description: The items contained within the directory (if the item is a directory). If not null, this field recursively applies the 'meta' schema to each contained item.

Source.description: The source category of the metadata.

Name.description: The name of the metadata (if being absorbed from an external file). Metadata generated internally will have a name of 'null'.

NameHashes.description: The checksums of the metadata's Name string. If the metadata is generated internally, this field will be null.

Data.description: The data of the metadata. This is a very generic field that can contain any type of data (so long as it doesn't break the JSON).
